maxogden i think caasi used official stroke data for ~1000 chars, and created some tool for dynamic composing less-frequently used chars
@maxogden: There are about 4000 glyphs with stroke from our Ministry of Education. They are scraped and processed to JSONs by c9s and au first: <https://github.com/g0v/zh-stroke-data>
slackbot3's url: [GitHub - g0v/zh-stroke-data: 常用國字標準字體筆劃 XML 資料檔]
@maxogden: If you want to draw them in HTML5 canvas, you can check moedict-webkit: <https://github.com/audreyt/moedict-webkit/tree/master/js>
slackbot3's url: [moedict-webkit/js at master · audreyt/moedict-webkit · GitHub]
If you want to draw them in SVG, check this: <https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-zh-stroker>

Composition is possible like what clkao said. But I don't know how to make them beautiful and usable. sih4sing5hong5 and @mgdesigner did a better job in this problem. You can check <https://github.com/sih4sing5hong5/han3_ji7_tsoo1_kian3>
